hypothesis_content.title: Bull-to-Neutral Transition via Divergence & Volume Dry-up
hypothesis_content.statement: During BULL regimes, when BTC makes a new 30-day high but with declining daily volume (3-day avg volume < 10-day avg volume * 0.8) AND daily MACD shows bearish divergence (price higher high, MACD lower high), the next 2% pullback signals transition to NEUTRAL, favoring volatility short/hedge positions.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Bull markets typically end not with crashes but with loss of momentum. Volume decline at new highs suggests weakening participation. MACD divergence indicates slowing momentum. The initial pullback often triggers profit-taking that transitions the market to neutral consolidation.
entry_conditions: MACD(12,26,9) shows bearish divergence (lower high on indicator)
Initial 2% pullback from the high occurs

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime confirms as NEUTRAL for 3 consecutive days
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price breaks to new high above divergence point with expanding volume

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 45% of such divergence patterns resolve bullishly with continued uptrend (failed divergence).
